III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of Staff.
Section Rule 126. The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
Description administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and other
staff on duty to perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency’s program statement and to
1

provide for the continual needs, protection, and supervision of
residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth B was touching Youth A's leg inappropriately. Youth B
walked two fingers starting at Youth A’s knees and went up to his
thigh. Youth A did not do anything about it, but he was
uncomfortable while it was occurring. Around 12/1/23, Youth B sat
on Youth A's lap and was trying to touch him inappropriately. She
had also sat on his back. Staff saw this occurring but did not know
to report it. The first week that Youth B was at the facility, Youth B
was trying to get close with Youth A and was trying to put her butt
on him. She had also written weird stuff in a notebook. It is
unknown what she specifically wrote. Youth B also sat on his lap.
There was another incident where Youth B tried to put her butt on
him. Youth B asked Youth A for "dick". Youth B hugged Youth A
inappropriately and touched him on his leg.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed face to face at the facility on
12/11/23. He reported being informed of the allegations by Youth
A. He was told the first incident occurred on 12/9/23 during
second shift and involved Youth B walking her fingers up the leg
of Youth A from below his knee to his private area. Youth A
informed Complainant, Youth A was uncomfortable but didn’t say
anything to Youth B. Youth A also informed Complainant that on
12/2/23 during third shift, Youth B tried to sit on Youth A’s lap but
ended up sitting on his back and trying to grab his private area.
Youth A reported to Complainant that Staff 1 would be able to
confirm this since Staff 1 was present. Complainant reported
being told by Youth A that during the first few weeks Youth B was
in the program, she attempted to put her butt on Youth A.
Complainant also reported observing Youth B follow Youth A
around and that other staff have indicated Youth B engages in
inappropriate behaviors towards others at times. Complainant
reported overhearing Youth A and Youth C say they will make
false allegations against Youth B because of her treatment of
them.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
12/11/23. She reported not being aware of the allegations but was
able to provide documentation of policies and safety plans for
youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/11/23.
She reported working 2nd shift last weekend but didn’t notice any
inappropriate behaviors by Youth B. She also reported Youth B is
“very boy crazy” because Youth B talks about all the boys she
2

likes at school. Staff 2 is aware of the safety plans and works to
keep Youth B away from the other youth, especially the male
youth. Staff 2 understood what would cause a report to be made
since she is a mandated reporter.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/11/23.
She reported working last week but not noticing any inappropriate
behaviors. She also reported being aware of the safety plans
between Youth A, Youth B and Youth C. If observing inappropriate
behavior, she would contact the supervisor and make a report if
abuse or neglect was suspected.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/11/23.
He reported being present when Youth A told Complainant about
the concerns but also reported he really didn’t hear what was
being said. He reported hearing from Youth C about Youth B
touching Youth C’s when Youth B was in her room for a safety
check, this was investigated 2024C0000921SI.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/11/23.
She reported not being aware of the allegations against Youth B
but did report Youth B is fearful of Youth C. She reported Youth C
was banging on the bedroom door of Youth B when Staff 5 was in
the bedroom with Youth B because Youth C was angry over Youth
B stealing from his room when Youth C was in the hospital. Youth
C was saying he was going to kill Youth B, so Staff 5 locked
herself and Youth B in Youth B’s bedroom until Youth C calmed
down. Staff 5 is aware of the safety plan of Youth B staying away
from other youth, especially male youth.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
12/11/23. Youth A reported Youth B kept touching Youth A
inappropriately and described how Youth A walked her fingers up
his leg towards his private area. Youth A reported being tired and
didn’t tell Youth B to stop. Youth A is fearful Youth B will call the
police if Youth A would push Youth B away to protect himself.
Youth A reported Staff 6 was present and told Youth B to stop and
move away from Youth A. Youth A reported a few weeks earlier,
Youth B attempted to sit on Youth A’s lap and Staff 1 was witness
to Youth B’s behaviors. Staff 1 told Youth B to stop but she
refused. Youth A reported when Youth B first came to the facility,
Youth B attempted to put Youth B’s butt on Youth C. Youth A feels
safe at the facility and staff are attentive and care about the youth.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
12/11/23. Youth C reported observing Youth B touch Youth A and
3

trying to sit on Youth A’s lap but was unsure when this occurred.
Youth C also reported Youth B is abusive toward Youth C
because Youth B will curse at Youth C “out of the blue” and
become verbally disrespectful towards Youth C. Youth C reported
observing the incident in the game room when Youth B walked
Youth B’s fingers up Youth A’s leg to the private area. Youth C
reported Youth B got into Youth C’s bedroom while Youth C was
in the hospital and stole a phone charger. Youth C doesn’t feel
safe at the facility with Youth B and fears Youth B will say
something to get Youth C put in jail.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
12/11/23. Youth B refused to speak about the allegations and
wanted to focus on “someone tried to kill me” rather than Youth
B’s behaviors. Youth B reported not having the energy to speak
and is too stressed out and upset. Youth B denied stealing
anything from Youth C’s room but did admit being questioned
about Youth B standing in the doorway and going through some of
Youth C’s items. Youth B reported being locked in the bedroom
with Staff 5 so Youth C couldn’t get to them. Youth B reported not
feeling safe at the facility because Youth C is unpredictable.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 12/18/23. He reported
remembering an incident involving Youth A and Youth B when
Youth B attempted to sit on the lap of Youth A and also tried to sit
on Youth A’s back. Youth B was redirected and refused the
redirection. Youth B then left the area. Staff 1 reported Youth B
specifically goes after Youth A during the night shift, and he
described this behavior as Youth B will touch or teasingly joke with
Youth A. Youth B will seek Youth A’s attention by throwing things
at him or engage in risky behaviors towards Youth A. Staff 1
reported not believing these issues to be neglect or abuse and
staff are always watching the youth.
Staff 6 was interviewed via phone on 12/19/23. She reported
being witness to the incident between Youth A and Youth B when
Youth B sat next to Youth A and walked her fingers up his leg.
She reported redirecting Youth B who cursed at her and refused
the redirection. Staff 6 then sat next to both Youth A and Youth B
and Youth B moved. Staff 6 described Youth B engaging in sexual
behavior towards others and generally occurs late at night (4-5
am) because Youth B will stay up late and refuse to go to bed.
Documents Reviewed:
4

Adolescent Residential Precaution Order dated 12/9/23 for
Youth A. This document outlines Youth A reported Youth B had
touched Youth A inappropriately in a sexual manner. Youth A and
Youth B are not to be alone without staff present, Youth A and
Youth B are to sit in separate rows in the van during transport and
will not sit adjacent to each other at any time.
Adolescent Residential Precaution Order dated 12/9/23 for
Youth B. This document outlines Youth B is reported to have
touched Youth A in a sexual manner. Youth A and Youth B are not
to be alone without staff present, Youth A and Youth B are to sit in
separate rows in the van during transport and will not sit adjacent
to each other at any time.
CPRS Clinical-Maple Lodge Safety Provisions for Youth B
dated 12/11/23. The reason for this document is stated as there
are reports Youth B is engaged in inappropriate boundaries
between Youth B and other youth at the facility. The action staff
are to engage in is to be within two arm’s length of Youth B
whenever Youth B is near any other youth in the facility. Staff are
to escort Youth B with other youth to the bus stop in the morning
and when Youth B and other youth return from school in the
afternoon.
Epic Progress Notes – Saturday, December 9th, 2023 for
Youth A. These notes document Youth A informing staff last
weekend that Youth B walked Youth B’s fingers up Youth A’s leg
in a sexual manner. Youth A reported to have disclosed the other
incidents he gave during this interview. Additionally, Youth A
reported Youth B asked him for “dick” and kept touching and
hugging Youth A inappropriately over the past few weeks.
Epic Progress Notes – Saturday, December 9th, 2023 for Youth B.
There is no inappropriate behaviors documented and Youth B is
on safety provisions. Youth B did get into an argument with Youth
C over Youth B going into Youth C’s room while Youth C was at
the hospital.
Epic Progress Notes – Sunday, December 10th, 2023 for Youth
B. Youth B talked with Youth C about going through Youth C’s
belongings which escalated Youth C. Youth B then went to the
bedroom and locked the door.
Epic Progress Notes – Sunday, December 10th, 2023 for Youth
C. Youth C became upset with Youth B over the taking of Youth
C’s items and after Youth C locked the bedroom door, Youth C
began banging on the door yelling Youth C would kill Youth B.
5

Staff were present throughout the incident and after security
showed up, Youth C went for a walk to calm down. After returning
Youth C still struggled but was able to complete the reflection form
and remained calm the rest of the shift.
Maple South Supervision of Coed Milieu dated 11/2023. The
document outlines staff’s responsibilities when monitoring youth in
the program. Staff are to ensure that youth maintain appropriate
boundaries in the home. Staff are to be aware of possible risks
that may arise and ensure youth are following the guidelines and
expectations of the program.
Analysis Based upon interviews and written documentation there is no
evidence that supports staff did not provide the necessary level of
supervision. Youth B is not following program rules as evidenced
by Youth B refusal to stop inappropriate behaviors when asked by
staff.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
